com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec

Class RequestMsgFlags

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec.RequestMsgFlags

  • public class RequestMsgFlags
extends java.lang.Object
    Combination of bit values to indicate special behaviors and the presence of optional RequestMsg content.
    See Also:
    RequestMsg

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CONF_INFO_IN_UPDATES
      (0x010) Indicates that the consumer wants to receive conflation information in update messages delivered on this stream.
      static int HAS_BATCH
      (0x800) Indicates that the request message payload contains a list of items of interest, all with matching msgKey information.
      static int HAS_EXTENDED_HEADER
      (0x001) Request Message has Extended Header

      (0x002) Has Priority

      (0x040) Indicates that Request has Qos

      (0x400) Indicates that the request message payload may contain a Dynamic View, specifying information the application wishes to receive (or that the application wishes to continue receiving a previously specified View).

      (0x080) Indicates that Request has Worst Qos

      (0x020) Indicates that the consumer application does not require a refresh for this request.

      (0x000) No Flags set

      static int PRIVATE_STREAM
      (0x100) Requests that the stream be opened as private
      static int QUALIFIED_STREAM
      (0x1000) Requests that the stream be opened as qualified
      static int STREAMING

        (0x002) Has Priority
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STREAMING

        public static final int STREAMING
        (0x004) Indicates whether the request is for streaming data.
        • If present, the OMM consumer wants to continue to receive changes to information after the initial refresh is complete.
        • If absent, the OMM consumer wants to receive only the refresh, after which the OMM Provider should close the stream. Such a request is typically referred to as a non-streaming or snapshot data request.
        Because a refresh can be split into multiple parts, it is possible for updates to occur between the first and last part of the refresh, even as part of a non-streaming request.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MSG_KEY_IN_UPDATES

        public static final int MSG_KEY_IN_UPDATES
        (0x008) Indicates that the consumer wants to receive the full msgKey in update messages. This flag does not control whether the msgKey is present in an update message. Instead, the provider application determines whether this information is present (the consumer should be capable of handling the msgKey in any UpdateMsg). When specified on a request to ADS, the ADS fulfils the request.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONF_INFO_IN_UPDATES

        public static final int CONF_INFO_IN_UPDATES
        (0x010) Indicates that the consumer wants to receive conflation information in update messages delivered on this stream. This flag does not control whether conflation information is present in update messages. Instead, the provider application determines whether this information is present,(the consumer should be capable of handling conflation information in any UpdateMsg).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NO_REFRESH

        public static final int NO_REFRESH
        (0x020) Indicates that the consumer application does not require a refresh for this request. This typically occurs after an initial request handshake is completed, usually to change stream attributes (e.g., priority). In some instances, a Provider may still deliver a refresh message (but if the consumer does not explicitly ask for it, the message should be unsolicited).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HAS_QOS

        public static final int HAS_QOS
        (0x040) Indicates that Request has Qos
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HAS_WORST_QOS

        public static final int HAS_WORST_QOS
        (0x080) Indicates that Request has Worst Qos
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PRIVATE_STREAM

        public static final int PRIVATE_STREAM
        (0x100) Requests that the stream be opened as private
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PAUSE

        public static final int PAUSE
        (0x200) Indicates that the consumer would like to pause the stream, though this does not guarantee that the stream will pause. To resume data flow, the consumer must send a subsequent request message with the STREAMING flag set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HAS_VIEW

        public static final int HAS_VIEW
        (0x400) Indicates that the request message payload may contain a Dynamic View, specifying information the application wishes to receive (or that the application wishes to continue receiving a previously specified View). If this flag is not present, any previously specified view is discarded and the full View is provided.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HAS_BATCH

        public static final int HAS_BATCH
        (0x800) Indicates that the request message payload contains a list of items of interest, all with matching msgKey information.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • QUALIFIED_STREAM

        public static final int QUALIFIED_STREAM
        (0x1000) Requests that the stream be opened as qualified
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
